subject: Re: [junit] Class Not Found error--Urgent
msgSnippet: Hi Anupama, I guess u need to verify these before u test 1. Verify the classpath for Junit, if its not there  add in u r classpath 2. while u create package as
messageBody:
Hi Anupama,
I guess u need to verify these before u test

1. Verify the classpath for Junit, if its not there add in u r classpath
2. while u create package as u had in u r case, compile from u package root. Example

if the package is com.boss.mytest

complie as javac com/boss/mytest/*.java or add u r class name ate the last rest remains the same.

3. The method assertEquals() is a comparator which will compare the strings leave a space after "return" in the HelloClass class

If these things does not work out, pls feel free to mail me again.

Thanks & Regards,
-sbada




anupama <anupama@...> wrote:
hi,

I am facing any problem while running the sample testcases,but while running my own testcases i am getting a problem as Class Not Found.

My source code is :
package samples;

public class HelloClass
{
public String sayHello()
{
return"Hello World";
}
}

My TestCase is:
package samples;

import samples.*;
import junit.framework.*;

public class TestHelloClass extends TestCase
{
public TestHelloClass(String s)
{
super(s);
}

public void testSayHello()
{
HelloClass helloObject= newHelloClass();
assertEquals(helloObject.sayHello(),"HelloWorld");
}

public static void main(String[] args)
{
junit.awtui.TestRunner.run(TestHelloClass.class);
}

}

I have placed both the files in the samples folder itself.
when i am running the above testcase i am facing class not found error.
can anyone give me the solution for this problem.Its urgent.

Thanks
Anupama
